Module chessClockWork
Package time

Class TimeBudgetConstraint

java.lang.Object
time.TimeBudgetConstraint
public final class TimeBudgetConstraint extends Object
Constraints for the player's timing.
Since:
1.0;

  • Method Details

    • makeNew

      public static final Optional<TimeBudgetConstraint> makeNew(TimeControlPhase[] tcps, long moveTimeLimit, long warningThreshold, boolean cumulativePhases)
      Generates a new constraint.
      Parameters:
      tcps - List of time control phases.
      moveTimeLimit - Time limit for each move, in nanoseconds. Use a negative value to indicate a missing move time limit.
      warningThreshold - Threshold time below which a warning is sent to the display that the player is short on time, in nanoseconds. Use a negative value to indicate that no warning may be sent.
      cumulativePhases - When switching to the next phase, is the time remaining from the last phase added to the time for the new one?
      Returns:
      Optional with the constraint. If tcps is null or has no entry, an empty optional is returned.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • getTCPs

      public final TimeControlPhase[] getTCPs()
      Returns the list of time control phases.
      Returns:
      The tcps list of time control phases.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • getMoveTimeLimit

      public final long getMoveTimeLimit()
      Returns the time limit for each move. Negative values indicate that there is no such limit.
      Returns:
      The move time limit, in nanoseconds.
      Since:
      1.0

    • getWarningThreshold

      public final long getWarningThreshold()
      Returns the time below which the short-on-time warning is turned on.
      Returns:
      The threshold time, in nanoseconds.
      Since:
      1.0;

    • isCumulativePhases

      public final boolean isCumulativePhases()
      Returns if phases behave cumulative. If so, the time remaining at the end of a phase is added to the time of the next phase.
      Returns:
      Phases are cumulative?
      Since:
      1.0;
